article.headline: Portland State 79, Idaho State 58
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- Seamus Boxley scored 22 points and grabbed 14 rebounds to lead Portland State to a 79-58 victory over Idaho State on Thursday night. Blake Walker added 20 points for the Vikings (18-6, 10-2), who won their sixth straight game and 12th consecutive home contest. Antone Jarrell had 14 points and Will Funn added 14 assists for the Vikings. Slim Millien led Idaho State (9-16, 3-9) with 14 points while Logan Kinghorn added 10 points. Walker started a 10-4 Portland State run with a thunderous dunk and Jarrell capped the run with a steal and layup that gave the Vikings a 27-15 lead with 6:33 left in the half. The Vikings extended their lead in the second half to as many as 23 points and coasted from there. Portland State shot 47 percent from the field while the Bengals struggled all night, hitting 17-of 52 (32 percent) from the floor. ^

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
